title: How to Make a HTML Link Button

steps.headline: Open up your HTML file with your preferred text editor such as Notepad or TextEdit.
Add the following code to the area where you want the button to appear:<form method="get" action="https://www.wikihow.com/Main-Page"><button type="submit">Home Page</button></form>
Change the link.
steps.description: Currently the code points to wikiHow's homepage. Replace it with the URL of the page you wish to link to.

steps.headline: Change the button text.
steps.description: Currently the button says "Homepage". You can change it to what ever you would like it to say.

steps.headline: Test out the link.
steps.description: Left click the link to make sure it works. If it works, then you're done. If the button does not, you should check your code for mistakes.
